Package tuitionmanager

Class Date

java.lang.Object
tuitionmanager.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Date>
public class Date extends Object implements Comparable<Date>
This is a class that creates a Date object given a String input or a Calendar instance. Also contains functionality to validate a Date object.
Author:
Aryan Patel

  • Constructor Details

    • Date

      public Date()
      Constructs a Date object using an instance of the current date retrieved from the Java Calendar library.

      Note: An additional month is added to the current Calendar instance to account for the zero base indexed representation of the months in Java's Calendar library

    • Date

      public Date(String date)
      Constructs a Date object from a String input that is split by '/' using the Java String Library. The resulting split output contains the deconstructed MM, DD, YYYY which is indexed into and stored.
      Parameters:
      date - String input which is a date in the format 'MM/DD/YYYY'

  • Method Details

    • getYear

      public int getYear()
      This method gets the year stored in a Date object.
      Returns:
      int which contains the year

    • getMonth

      public int getMonth()

      Returns:

    • getDay

      public int getDay()
      This method gets the day stored in a Date object.
      Returns:
      int which contains the day

    • isLeapYear

      private boolean isLeapYear(int year)
      This method determines if an inputted year is a leap year or not based on the following steps:

      Step 1: If the year is evenly divisible by 4, go to step 2. Otherwise, go to step 5. Step 2: If the year is evenly divisible by 100, go to step 3. Otherwise, go to step 4. Step 3: If the year is evenly divisible by 400, go to step 4. Otherwise, go to step 5. Step 4: The year is a leap year. Step 5: The year is not a leap year.

      Parameters:
      year - int input that is to be validated as a leap year or not
      Returns:
      boolean which refers to whether the inputted year is a leap year or not

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      This method determines if a Date object is a valid date or not.

      The method makes use of standard conventions and knowledge to determine if the Date object is valid or not.

      Returns:
      boolean which refers to whether the Date object is a valid date or not

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      This method determines if a Date object is equal to another given Object.

      The process of checking equality involves first checking if the given Object is the Date object itself. If not, it then checks if the given object is an instance of the Date Class before it checks the equality of the month, day, and year values between the two objects.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - Object input that is to be checked if it is equal to another Date object
      Returns:
      boolean which refers to whether the given Object is equal to another Date Object

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Date date)
      This method compares a Date object with another Date object.

      The order of comparison is as follows: YYYY, MM, DD. The method returns an int value which represents the relative position (BEFORE, AFTER, SAME), of one Date Object to the other.

      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      date - Date input that is to be compared
      Returns:
      int which contains a value representing the relative the order.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      This method returns the Date object as a string containing the year, month, and day.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String which represents a Date object in the format 'MM/DD/YYYY'
